page.title: 01Herm Island, a general view.
page.content: Herm is an island in the English Channel. It is one of a group of islands that are called the Channel Islands. The largest island is Jersey, then Guernsey, Alderney, Sark, Herm and Jethou. Herm is one of the smallest inhabited Channel Islands. About forty people live in Herm. It is part of the Bailiwick of Guernsey, governed by the States of Guernsey, and is leased from them by the present tenant Major Peter Wood. Herm is one and a half miles long and half a mile wide and lies three miles off the east coast of Guernsey. The island's economy is based on farming and tourism, for both of which it is well suited.
